page.title: 01NORTHERNMOST TIP OF ALDERNEY
page.content: Features four of the islands 16 victorian forts built to defend Britain's new anchorage for her channel fleet against the France of Napoleon III. Two lights maintained by Trinity House can be found, the Quesnel lighthouse dates from 1912 and was primarily built to the total wreck of the four masted Liverpool, the biggest sailing ship of her day. The small directional light on L'Etoc was built to assist yatchsmen entering Brayne Harbour. With tides up to 6 knots and numerous outlying rocks makes this a very dangerous coastline except for Saye & Corblets Bays which are suberb for swimming. Also the campsite which was the site of a German forced labour camp during World War II. Arch Bay is so named after a tunnel under an old railway line which was built to allow islanders to
